Reputation Game v2
  • Simulate
  • View page source

Simulate¶

class simulate.game.Game(characters_setup: dict)¶

Bases: object

Manages game simulations, including setup, execution, and post-processing.

conf¶

Simulation configuration settings.

Type:

dict

characters_setup¶

Setup for characters in the simulation. Format: {agent_id: character, agent_id: type, …} Each key defines the character for that specific agent. If “all” is a key, all agents not mentioned will get that character.

Type:

dict

outfile_name¶

Name of the file to store simulation results.

Type:

str

simulations¶

List of Simulation instances.

Type:

list

output(results: list, filename: str) → None¶

Saves simulation results to a JSON file.

Parameters:

  • results (list) – List of simulation results.

  • filename (str) – Filename to save the results.

run(override: bool) → None¶

Runs the simulations and passes results to output function.

If the results file exists and override is False, skips the simulation.

Parameters:

override (bool) – If True, runs simulations even if the output file exists.

setup_simulations() → None¶

Prepares simulations based on config and character setup.

simulate.game.play(sim: Simulation) → dict¶

Plays a simulation. This is just a function for parallel processing.

Parameters:

sim (Simulation) – A Simulation instance.

Returns:

The result of the simulation.

Return type:

dict

class simulate.simulation.Simulation(seed: int, characters_setup: dict, conf: dict)¶

Bases: object

Manages the simulation process, including agent initialization, conversation scheduling, and running the simulation.

conf¶

Simulation configuration settings.

Type:

dict

random¶

Randomized values generated using the seed.

Type:

dict

characters_setup¶

Dictionary specifying character traits for agents.

Type:

dict

id¶

The unique identifier for this simulation (seed).

Type:

int

log¶

Logger for tracking simulation data.

Type:

Logger

agents¶

List of initialized Agent objects.

Type:

list

conversations¶

List of scheduled Conversation objects.

Type:

list

init_agents()¶

Initializes agents for the simulation based on the configuration and character setup.

Agents are assigned honesty levels and characters either from the setup or randomly. The random dict is simulation-specific, thus passed onto the simulation’s agents.

play() → list[dict]¶

Runs the simulation by processing each conversation round and logging the results.

Returns:

A list of results containing initial states and outcomes of each conversation.

Return type:

list[dict]

schedule_conversations() → list[Conversation]¶

Schedules conversations for the agents based on the configuration.

Returns:

A list of Conversation objects scheduled for the simulation.

Return type:

list[Conversation]

class simulate.conversation.Conversation(conf: any, speaker: Agent, random: dict, agents: list[Agent])¶

Bases: object

Represents a conversation between agents, managing the dialogue and interactions.

conf¶

Configuration settings for the conversation. Passed as arg to avoid loading again.

Type:

any

speaker¶

The agent initiating the conversation.

Type:

Agent

random¶

Random values for managing conversation dynamics.

Type:

dict

agents¶

List of all agents participating in the conversation.

Type:

list[Agent]

setting¶

The type of conversation setting (e.g., one-to-one).

Type:

str

listeners¶

Selected listeners for the conversation.

Type:

dict

topic¶

The topic of conversation.

Type:

str

initiate_conversation()¶

Initializes the conversation by selecting its setting, listeners, and topic.

pick_listeners()¶

Chooses the listeners for the conversation based on the selected setting.

pick_setting()¶

Selects the conversation setting based on the speaker’s preferences.

pick_topic()¶

Selects the topic of conversation based on the speaker’s preferences.

run_conversation_protocol()¶

Executes the conversation protocol, managing message exchanges between agents (sending, receiving, updating).

Returns:

The attributes of all participating agents that changed during the simulation.

Return type:

dict

save_state()¶

Saves the state of the conversation based on the current setting.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the attributes of all participating agents that changed during the simulation.

Return type:

dict
